commit message:
Initial commit

Added TechTalkDemo from TFG
Refactored names and fixed vertical moving.
Resized the paddle and moved the paddle to lower position.

Refactored Quad object

So we can create almost any type of quadratic objects (except for
rhombus) with just one object.

Create Constant class

This allow us to define new forms/colors without poluting source code

Add bricks form and a level create method

This is probably dependant of screen resolution, maybe it`s better to
get the value from screen width/height.
Added constants related to fps rate and collision detection.
Created a class Ball that inherits from Quad.
Called a method to move the ball.
Created a class to keep the game state.
Detected collision between the ball and wall.

Set a specific ball movement rate.

Now the ball move in a different rate from the frame update rate. I also
created constants to define the type of collision.
Moved get methods to Quad Type.
Added methods to get the position.
Started to implement the collision detection.

Using specific class to each Form extending Quad

This make it easier to expand funcionality later
Put constants on the correct class
Put method createGame on the correct class

Put forms on a separate folder

This makes the code more organized

Better logging

Move on frame update logging to verbose instead of debugging, so we can
filter all log spam.

Move frame rate limitter to TouchSurfaceView

This makes more sense since we can control the whole frame rate this way
(including paddle) instead of only limitting the frame rate of Game
rendered objects (ball and bricks).

Substitute frame rate limitter to FPS status

Since Android seems to be limited to 60FPS, doesn't make much sense to
have a frame rate limitter.

Revert 'Substitute frame rate limitter to FPS status'

This reverts commit 410ea57e5635ce7d73c62c8a4c93cd8fad6bc3ae.

Add FPS counter

I did removed frame limitter but I am afraid that some devices maybe too
slow to run this game smooth. So just add FPS counter and maintain the
frame limitter.

Remove speed parameter from Ball object

Updating ball rendering and collision detection asynchrony seems to
cause weird bugs (like the ball colliding on nothing when it bounces on
the corner of the screen). This is probably because with async updates
the collision can be detected too late (when the ball already passed the
'safe' X and Y position) so it gets a position where the ball can bounce
forever (or at least until the position gets to a safe place again).

So if we do need to lower requirements to get a acceptable performance,
it's better to just limit the frame rate of rendering (see commit
310d6d0ee55) instead of trying to be clever creating a async update.
Calculate ball speed according to FPS limit

Disable FPS limiter for now

And make it easier to enable it later

Put collision status on Constants

And create a Enum type (better organized)
Refactor get position, reducing code repetition

Convert Quad to abstract class

Since it doesn't make sense to create a pure Quad on our application
(this class should be extended to create our game objects), convert
this class to abstract.

Make ball speed depends on actual speed instead of constant

And remove frame limiter code, this seems silly now

Fix draw bug

The operations order do matter

Change lowest FPS limit

And allow user to fix FPS, this time in a much cleaner way.

Fix mPrevFrameTime initialization

This is why mDeltaTime was starting with strange values

New limit fps method

This works much better

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/detectingCollision2'

Conflicts:
EP2/src/br/usp/ime/ep2/Game.java
EP2/src/br/usp/ime/ep2/forms/Ball.java
Detect wall collision with ball corners instead of center
Now the ball can go to different directions.
Limited the move increment in both direction.
Fixed the direction to which the ball move.
Convert updateState function back to void

Cleanup code from paddle/ball collision detection

There is no need to pass parameters to detectCollision() function just
to garantee that the values are gonna be equal. Remember: the position
is only updated onDraw.
Fix small error on paddle/ball collision detection

New algorithm to detect collision

Much simpler than before, and should be more accurated too. Add brick
collision prototype too.

Added a proper ball/brick collision case

Still the same as WALL_TOP_BOTTOM_SIDE

Add some gameplay mechanics

An score multiplier, that increments when you succesfully hit bricks
without needing the help of the paddle, decrements when you hit the
paddle various times without hitting a brick and resetting to zero when
the level restarts (not implemented yet)

Show score on the UI

But we should call the updateScore() function on another place, need to
figure out how to get the MainActivity thread on one of it's child.

Implemented a new way to set the direction of ball after hit the paddle.

We see the paddle as a circumference (actually, as half of a
circumference). If the ball hit the left part of the paddle, it will
move to the left (analogously to the right). The angle of reflection is
proportional to how far from the center the ball hit the paddle.
Refactored code, fix a bug when the game was suspended

Implement timelly updates to UI

It's not pretty but at least it works
Now the ball can move along the Y axis.

Fix the most annoying bugs from ball going out of screen

But there are still some strange ones
Forget to change base score to constant
Starting to implement different kind of bricks.

Refactored game status code

Put it on a static class, so we can better organize the code
Forgot to reset score multiplier when player die
Added high score and store it on SharedPreferences

Added a special brick.

There is a special kind of brick called the gray brick. This brick is
generated with probability of 20%. You have to hit two times the gray
brick in order to break it. All the bricks now have a private field
called lives.

Less text on UI

This should allow the game runs on smaller screens
Inform user if he got a new high score
Implemented brick explosion and cleaned code.

Add audio effect when user loses a ball

And some code refactoring
Changed probability to create a gray brick.
Changed the color of the explosive bricks when they are hit.
Added reference to the implementation of the explosion effect.

Refactor sound effects id

Using a HashMap is much better than a vector

Merge branch 'differentKindBricks' into sound_effects

EP2/src/br/usp/ime/ep2/Game.java
Add sound effect to explosive brick
Add sound effect when user gets a new high score
Fixed collision between ball and top/bottom wall.

Remove appcompat from build

We don't need a 2MB+ library just to make a better UI
Now the hard (gray) and explosive are different bricks.
Now consecutive mobile bricks start moving to different directions.
Set better values for the probabilities of the bricks.

Added method to get form size

And use it to create level
Change colors to a more retro style
Change text color to match retro style
Add localization support (but no actual translation)

Change initial Y position of bricks

The older value was too high
Fix two small bugs and clean up code
Change brick probability according to user level choice
I think this fixed the FC

Remove ball speed update on frame

With a proper game loop we won't need to update ball speed on each frame
Add a better way to set FPS limit
Only start the game when user touchs the screen
If user lost ball, pause the game too

Change method/variable name

This makes more sense
Added a TextView with info that the game is paused

Change bricks initial position

t was shadowing the ready TextView
Change the number of default lives
Save user level preferences so we can restore it

Change ball starting position again

But this time the initial position should be more fare (the ball starts
from a higher Y position and hit the paddle almost at the middle of X
position)
Pause the game when the user exits the app

Don't allow user to move paddle on paused state

This would make the gamer much easier
Freeze paddle movement when game is over too

Definitive fix to FC

But the High Score dialog may not show
Fix fixed ratio logic, added immersive mode
Add a better explanation what is happening here

Refactored difficult settings

Using a Constant is better than writting everything

Disable wall

It's not necessary anymore
Rename workspace to retrobreaker instead of ep2

Delete android-support-v4 lib

We don't use it

Fix execution on anything less than KitKat

And use HoloDark theme on Honeycomb+ for dialog.

Set default theme to dark/black

This looks better with the thematic of the game. And remove values-v14
since we don't need ActionBar.
Fix start Y position of bricks
Probably fix to infinite wall collision
Don't need to initialize the values again

Refactored code

Remove all static variables from non static classes
This should fix wall infinitaly collision
Better explanation of what is happening here

This reverts commit a30e8d44257c1ca9cfa66619fa8c5409eba029bc.

Refactored consecutive collision detection code

Now it's much better and detect other cases of multiple consecutive
collisions too.
A comment explaining better what is happening here
Add point bonus for each extra life the user has
Refactor mobile bricks code and faster bricks on higher difficults
Added speed to mobile bricks on can't die difficult
Change hard difficult life score bonus

Revert 'Refactore consecutive collision detection code'

This reverts commit 6d404b71ba1b9c43374b551942e02931a04e3ab7.

Change wall/paddle collision detection order

So we can at least fail (i.e. make user lose a life) in case of problems

Make the paddle bigger

Suggestion made by André Spanguero Kanayama

Improved the update function of Particle class.
Fix timer comment, increase update rate
Refatored code for consecutive collision detection
